sp_widget.name: survey form
sp_widget.template:
Background:

  • This review is part of the follow-up from a working group of the NIH Advisory Committee to the Director (ACD) on the MACH trial, and subsequent conversations about improving guidelines on public-private partnerships and program processes.
  • In parallel to additional policy development and new training opportunities, the questions below are the basis of NIH's initial scan of all portfolios and potential issues to examine, as raised by the ACD.
  • This is being conducted as part of NIH's strategic risk management efforts and each IC is being asked to provide aggregate responses to the NIH OD. Your responses will be used by the NCI OD to develop that submission.
  • It is one of several ways we are identifying further ways to shore up the public trust in NIH-supported research, and that we are performing due diligence to be responsive to both the NIH Advisory Committee to the Director, and external stakeholders in biomedical research.

Instructions:

Responses marked with an asterisk () should be reported up to IC leadership for awareness and, if necessary, further review. If unsure of the answer, staff should report this up to leadership for awareness as well.

Submitted for:
Institute/Center:
Section I
Within the past 24 months, have you established, or are you currently pursuing the establishment of, a partnership with a private partner (such as an industry partner, or private foundation)?
Yes No
Please answer the following questions:
1) Consider how you developed the partnership, and the steps you took to add transparency to the development of your partnership:
a) Are you prepared to make fully public the process of how the IC’s relationships with this/(these) organization/(s) were initiated and developed?
Yes
No
Unsure
b) Can you supply any available documentation of staff interactions with partners prior to and during the conduct of the partnership? (Documentation examples: notes from meetings, email documents, calendar entries, notes to files)
Yes
No
Unsure
2) Are there other organizations with similar assets/expertise who could have potentially served as partners?
Yes
No
Can you give specifics as to why you chose this organization, why other entities were not selected, and why other entities did not meet your ICO’s needs?
Yes
No
Unsure
3) Is your activity a renewal or continuation of a previous partnership?
Yes
No
Explain the justification for the renewal or continuation of the partnership (e.g., the unique nature of the organization or the need to expand the prior relationship)
4) Does the partnership support program/s funded through a dedicated FOA (e.g., not a parent FOA)?
Yes
No
Please list the specific FOA numbers:
Did all these FOAs go through concept clearance through presentation to an open session of an advisory council?
Yes
No
Please describe who did clear it and the type of documentation that could be provided in the field below
5) For partnership activities via cooperative agreements and/or contracts, if the ongoing or proposed activity involves human participants or animal subjects:
a) Has the risk to either humans or animals been assessed?
Yes
No
Unsure
Do you have documentation of this?
Yes
No
Unsure
b) In addition to appropriate IRB or IACUC approvals, can you confirm that the final study design was approved by NIH staff?
Yes
No
Unsure
Do you have documentation of this?
Yes
No
Unsure
6) If the partnerships provide any assets: what is the nature of any asset(s) to be provided by the partner? (Select those that apply)
Intellectual only
Can you both define and document the role and contribution of the partner?
Yes
No
Interventional molecule, biological, or device
Has potential risk been assessed, and is it documented?
Yes
No
Non-unique material entity (e.g., generic drug, supplies)
Monetary
is the amount…
>$1M
Restricted
Unrestricted
>$10M
Restricted
Unrestricted
No assets provided
7) For each industry partnership, please address these questions related to public perception of the partnership:
a) Has the company received notable public scrutiny within the past 5 years (e.g., mainstream press coverage of controversial actions)?
Yes
No
b) Is the primary use of the company’s product or resources related to improving health or to scientific discovery?
Yes
No
  • Explain the risk (e.g., partner’s business is controversial, partner’s product is known to be harmful to human life) and why the benefit from the relationship outweighs the potential damage to the IC’s reputation.
  • Describe the actions you took to mitigate the harm that will arise from the relationship.
8) For each partnership with a non-profit organization, please address these questions related to public perception of the partnership:
a) Has the organization received notable public scrutiny within the past 5 years (e.g., mainstream press coverage of controversial actions)?
Yes
No
b) Is the primary aim of the organization related to improving health or to scientific discovery?
Yes
No
  • Explain any potential risks (e.g., the nonprofit is fully funded by industries of a controversial nature, or industries where primary product is known to be harmful to human health) and why the benefit from the relationship outweighs the potential damage to the IC’s reputation.
  • Describe the actions you took to mitigate the harm that will arise from the relationship.
Section II: For all program officers/program directors
1) Have external scientific experts participated directly in writing FOA(s)?
Yes
No
2) Have external scientific experts participated directly in writing contract solicitation language?
Yes
No
3) In the past 12 months, have you published any RFAs or PARs without obtaining concept clearance at an open session of an advisory council?
Yes
No
What follow-up actions, if any, have been taken?
4) In the past 12 months, have you communicated confidential details (such as release or due dates) of pending FOAs to people external to NIH?
Yes
No
What corrective actions, if any, have been taken?
5) In the past 12 months, are you aware of any substantiated complaints of inequitable treatment (e.g., preferential treatment or non-responsiveness) by any of your program staff?
Yes
No
What corrective actions, if any, have been taken?
6) In the past 12 months, are you aware of any grants in which there were arrangements by or with the grantee that involved industry in the NIH-funded project/research?
Yes
No
i. Can you provide documentation demonstrating disclosure to NIH by the institution that received the grant(s)?
Yes
No
ii. Can you provide documentation demonstrating management of (potential) changes in scope, research plan, budget, conflicts of interest, etc.?
Yes
No
For IC senior leadership (e.g., division directors - designate as appropriate)
7) In the past 12 months, are you aware of any program staff communicating confidential details (such as release or due dates) of pending FOAs to people external to NIH?
Yes
No
What corrective actions, if any, have been taken?
8) In the past 12 months, are you aware of any substantiated complaints of inequitable treatment (e.g., preferential treatment or non-responsiveness) by any of your program staff?
Yes
No
What corrective actions, if any, have been taken?
Information Dialog
Are you ready to submit the form?
